knowledge: Hypertension Hypertension Descriptions of hypertension as a disease came among others from Thomas Young in 1808 and especially Richard Bright in 1836.  The first report of elevated blood pressure in a person without evidence of kidney disease was made by Frederick Akbar Mahomed . Historically the treatment for what was called the 'hard pulse disease' consisted in reducing the quantity of blood by bloodletting or the application of leeches.  This was advocated by The Yellow Emperor of China, Cornelius Celsus, Galen, and Hippocrates.  The therapeutic approach for the treatment of hard pulse disease included changes in lifestyle  and dietary program for patients . In the 19th and 20th centuries, before effective pharmacological treatment for hypertension became possible, three treatment modalities were used, all with numerous side-effects: strict sodium restriction , sympathectomy , and pyrogen therapy . The first chemical for hypertension, sodium thiocyanate, was used in 1900 but had many side effects and was unpopular Hypertension Hypertension

knowledge: Hypertension Hypertension Descriptions of hypertension as a disease came among others from Thomas Young in 1808 and especially Richard Bright in 1836.  The first report of elevated blood pressure in a person without evidence of kidney disease was made by Frederick Akbar Mahomed . Historically the treatment for what was called the hard pulse disease consisted in reducing the quantity of blood by bloodletting or the application of leeches.  This was advocated by The Yellow Emperor of China, Cornelius Celsus, Galen, and Hippocrates.  The therapeutic approach for the treatment of hard pulse disease included changes in lifestyle  and dietary program for patients . In the 19th and 20th centuries, before effective pharmacological treatment for hypertension became possible, three treatment modalities were used, all with numerous side-effects: strict sodium restriction , sympathectomy , and pyrogen therapy . The first chemical for hypertension, sodium thiocyanate, was used in 1900 but had many side effects and was unpopular Hypertension Hypertension
response: It is recommended to check your blood pressure at home at least once a week and keep track of the readings.

knowledge: Gallstones Gallstones  Gallstones are hardened deposits of digestive fluid that can form in your gallbladder.  Your gallbladder is a small, pear-shaped organ on the right side of your abdomen, just beneath your liver.  Gallstones range in size from as small as a grain of sand to as large as a golf ball.  Some people develop just one gallstone, while others develop many gallstones at the same time.  Other factors that contribute to the formation of gallstones include a diet high in fat or cholesterol, rapid weight loss, and diabetes. Gallstones can cause severe abdominal pain and other symptoms such as nausea and vomiting, fever and chills, jaundice, and clay-colored stools.  Treatment for gallstones may involve surgery to remove the gallbladder or medication to dissolve the stones. Gallstones Gallstones
